Text:
You're always first (hurray!).  Your quality is consistently great.  But would it kill you to leave on the closing credits, at least until the names of all the actors have been displayed if you don't want to include the copyright and legal mumbo-jumbo at the very end?

Thanks.

P.S.  The closing music - always a period pop song somehow relevant to the episode - is a very important feature of "Mad Men," and tonight we just gt two seconds of it before the screen went to black.  If I am not mistaken, it was Paul Mauriat's "Love is Blue" and would have helped ease one off the high emotions of this episode.
I know exactly what you mean, it does spoil the moment when it comes to an abrupt end, another few seconds would be nice while reflecting on what has just happened.
